unnormalised: The fiscal year 2022-23 was a mixed bag for Sharma Industries, a family-run business in Jaipur. Papa, Mr. R.K. Sharma, had always been meticulous with the books, but even he admitted the numbers this time around told a more complex story than usual. It wasn’t simply a matter of black and white profit margins; there were shades of grey reflecting the changing economic landscape.
normalised: The fiscal year two thousand twenty two to two thousand twenty three was a mixed bag for Sharma Industries, a family-run business in Jaipur. Papa, Mister R.K. Sharma, had always been meticulous with the books, but even he admitted the numbers this time around told a more complex story than usual. It wasn’t simply a matter of black and white profit margins; there were shades of grey reflecting the changing economic landscape.

unnormalised: Our initial projections, as laid out in the budget on 01/04/2022, anticipated a 15% growth in revenue. However, the quarterly reports revealed a different reality. Q1 saw a modest 8% increase, while Q2 dipped to a disappointing 4%. The culprit? Rising raw material costs, particularly steel and cement, which jumped by nearly 20% YoY. Mama always said, "You can't control the market," but still, we tried to navigate the storm.
normalised: Our initial projections, as laid out in the budget on first april two thousand twenty two, anticipated a fifteen percent growth in revenue. However, the quarterly reports revealed a different reality. Q one saw a modest eight percent increase, while Q two dipped to a disappointing four percent. The culprit? Rising raw material costs, particularly steel and cement, which jumped by nearly twenty percent year over year. Mama always said, "You can't control the market," but still, we tried to navigate the storm.

unnormalised: The mid-year review in Oct '22 forced us to re-evaluate our strategy. We implemented cost-cutting measures, reducing marketing spend by Rs. 5 lakhs and streamlining our operational processes. These efforts yielded some positive results, with Q3 showing a slight improvement to 6% growth. However, the real game-changer came in Q4.
normalised: The mid-year review in october twenty two forced us to re-evaluate our strategy. We implemented cost-cutting measures, reducing marketing spend by rupee five lakhs and streamlining our operational processes. These efforts yielded some positive results, with Q three showing a slight improvement to six percent growth. However, the real game-changer came in Q four.

unnormalised: In Jan '23, the government announced a new infrastructure project in Rajasthan, injecting much-needed stimulus into the local economy. Sharma Industries, being a key supplier of construction materials, benefited significantly. Our revenue soared by 25% in Q4, exceeding all expectations. As a result, the annual revenue growth reached 12%, just shy of our initial target.
normalised: In january twenty three, the government announced a new infrastructure project in Rajasthan, injecting much-needed stimulus into the local economy. Sharma Industries, being a key supplier of construction materials, benefited significantly. Our revenue soared by twenty five percent in Q four, exceeding all expectations. As a result, the annual revenue growth reached twelve percent, just shy of our initial target.

unnormalised: The final balance sheet showed a profit of Rs. 2.5 crores, a respectable figure considering the challenges we faced. However, the debt-to-equity ratio remained high at 1.8, indicating a need for further financial restructuring. Papa's already planning for FY 2023-24. He projects 18% growth, but knowing him, he’s prepared for anything.
normalised: The final balance sheet showed a profit of rupee two point five crores, a respectable figure considering the challenges we faced. However, the debt-to-equity ratio remained high at one point eight, indicating a need for further financial restructuring. Papa's already planning for F-Y two thousand twenty three to two thousand twenty four. He projects eighteen percent growth, but knowing him, he’s prepared for anything.

unnormalised: Despite the ups and downs, FY 2022-23 taught us valuable lessons about resilience, adaptability, and the importance of staying true to our values. Even with all the spreadsheets and calculations, in the end, it all comes down to people and relationships. And with that, we ended the fiscal year.
normalised: Despite the ups and downs, F-Y two thousand twenty two to two thousand twenty three taught us valuable lessons about resilience, adaptability, and the importance of staying true to our values. Even with all the spreadsheets and calculations, in the end, it all comes down to people and relationships. And with that, we ended the fiscal year.
